Class DocIndexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.DocIndexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocIndexerAbstract, DocIndexerBase

    public abstract class DocIndexer
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Indexes a file.

      • setDocument

        public abstract void setDocument(Reader reader)
        Set the document to index. NOTE: you should generally prefer calling the File or byte[] versions of this method, as those can be more efficient (e.g. when using DocIndexer that parses using VTD-XML).
        Parameters:
        reader - document

        Parameters:

      • setOmitNorms

        public void setOmitNorms(boolean b)
        Enables or disables norms. Norms are disabled by default. The method name was chosen to match Lucene's Field.setOmitNorms(). Norms are only required if you want to use document-length-normalized scoring.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, doesn't store norms; if false, does store norms

      • addNumericFields

        public void addNumericFields(Collection<String> fields)

      • warn

      • addMetadataField

        public void addMetadataField(String name,
                             String value)

      • addMetadataFieldsFromParameters

        protected void addMetadataFieldsFromParameters()
        If any metadata fields were supplied in the indexer parameters, add them now. NOTE: we always add these untokenized (because they're usually just indications of which data set a set of files belongs to), but that means they don't get lowercased or de-accented. Because metadata queries are always desensitized, you can't use uppercase or accented letters in these values or they will never be found. This should be addressed.

      • getSensitivitySetting

public ComplexFieldProperty.SensitivitySetting getSensitivitySetting(String propName)
